record.title: HEROES EARNINGS ASSISTANCE AND RELIEF TAX ACT OF 2007
record.narrative:
HEROES EARNINGS ASSISTANCE AND RELIEF TAX ACT OF 2007 -- (Senate - December 12, 2007)

[Page: S15377]

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the Senate proceed to the immediate consideration of Calendar No. 516, H.R. 3997.

record.chair: The clerk will state the bill by title.
record.narrative: The legislative clerk read as follows:

A bill (H.R. 3997) to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide earnings assistance and tax relief to members of the uniformed services, volunteer firefighters, and Peace Corps volunteers, and for other purposes.
There being no objection, the Senate proceeded to consider the bill.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the amendment at the desk be considered and agreed to; the bill, as amended, be read the third time and passed; that the motion to reconsider be laid upon the table; and that any statements relating thereto be printed in the Record, without intervening action or debate.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
The amendment (No. 3848) was agreed to, as follows:
Amend the title so as to read: "An Act to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide tax relief and protections for military personnel, and for other purposes.".
The bill (H.R. 3997), as amended, was ordered to a third reading, was read the third time, and passed.
